frameDefinitions: A Cognizer thinks that the Information given by a particular Source is correct.
A Believer has faith in a piece of Content or an Element  which fits into a religious belief system made up of many articles of faith.
A Cognizer decides upon the Chosen (either an item or a course of action) out of a set of  Possibilities .
This frame concerns a Cognizer's certainty about the correctness of beliefs  or expectations.
A Cognizer holds a particular Opinion, which may be portrayed as being about a particular Topic.
An Inspector attains a degree of certainty in the Unconfirmed_content, generally by inspecting some evidence.
frameExamples: Do Muslims <t>believe</t> in the virgin birth of Jesus?
The council <t>picked</t> you out of all the pilots available to head this mission.
Lermontov was <t>certain</t> he would come to the party.
John <t>thinks</t> that it looks better back .
listRoleDefinitions: The <fen>Cognizer</fen> is the person who has an opinion about the reliability of a <fen>Information_source</fen> or the <fen>Information</fen> from the <fen>Information_source</fen>.
An object or action associated with the <fen>Cognizer</fen> which is so affected by the <fen>Cognizer</fen>'s belief that it reveals the <fen>Cognizer</fen>'s state.
The individual that gives Information to the <fen>Cognizer</fen>.
The text or speech which the <fen>Cognizer</fen> has heard and evaluates the truth of.
The <fen>Believer</fen> is the person whose religious beliefs are in question.
The <fen>Content</fen> is the object of the <fen>Believer</fen>'s religious conviction. <fen>Content</fen> can be expressed as a finite clause or in a in-PP Complement.
<fen>Role</fen> is a  function that an Element of the faith is believed to serve.
A predefined, fixed idea to which reference is made throughout the belief system.
The <fen>Cognizer</fen> chooses the <fen>Chosen</fen> out of the <fen>Possibilities</fen>.
<fen>Chosen</fen> identifies the entity or course of action which is selected from among the <fen>Possibilities</fen>.

A <fen>Cognizer</fen> makes a choice from among a set of <fen>Possibilities</fen>. <fen>Possibilities</fen> are commonly expressed via an oblique phrase which indicates the alternative or alternatives, or by a subordinate clause (choosing to do it or choosing not to do it), typically headed by 'whether or 'if'.
This role identifies the <fen>Time</fen> when the <fen>Cognizer</fen> chooses the <fen>Chosen</fen>.
This role identifies the <fen>Place</fen> where the choosing occurs.
The <fen>Cognizer</fen> is the person whose certainty or uncertainty is at issue.
The <fen>Topic</fen> is the entity that a <fen>Cognizer</fen> has a certain/uncertain belief about.
The <fen>Content</fen> denotes the mental content that the <fen>Cognizer</fen> is certain or uncertain about.
The <fen>Expressor</fen> is the body part or action by a body part that conveys the mental state of  the <fen>Cognizer</fen>.
The <fen>Cognizer</fen> is the person whose <fen>Opinion</fen> is in question.
The <fen>Cognizer</fen>'s way of thinking, which is not necessarily generally accepted, and which is generally dependent on the <fen>Cognizer</fen>'s point of view.
The <fen>Time</fen> at which the <fen>Cognizer</fen> has the <fen>Opinion</fen>.
The individual or individuals that ascertain that the <fen>Unconfirmed_content</fen> is true.
An open proposition that the <fen>Inspector</fen> decides by examining evidence.  It is usually a propostion put forward which some parties would disbelieve or contest.
The <fen>Medium</fen> is the piece of text or work in which the <fen>Inspector</fen> verifies the <fen>Unconfirmed_content</fen>:
This role describes the <fen>Time</fen> at which the verification event takes place.
This role describes where the verificiation event takes place.
listRoleExamples: Her trustworthy <fex>eyes</fex> revealed that I was in no danger.
Why should we believe <fex>him</fex> ?
America trusted <fex>his declaration</fex> , to their detriment .
A Christian believes <fex>that Jesus of Nazareth was a prophet</fex>.
If a person believes in Jesus <fex>as his Saviour</fex>, he can he baptized.
I believe <fex>in Jesus</fex>
<fex>We</fex>have to pick a colour for the living room.
I decided <fex>to give it another try</fex>.
They chose their new guitarist <fex>out of more than 300 auditioners</fex>.
I was n't chosen <fex>in the last round</fex>.
The winner was selected <fex>in the secret meeting room</fex>.
<fex>Marcel</fex> was sure that she had seen Eldridge on the balcony.
She talked of quests , of finding this absurd religious character , but he was unsure <fex>of her conviction</fex>.
I am sure <fex>that we'll arrive on time</fex>.
She caught sight of her mother's dubious <fex>expression</fex>.
<fex>My</fex> take is that Johnson will not actually make it to the last round .

My take is <fex>that it is a version of the Macbeth story - what happens when people
become violent but cannot quite handle it</fex>.
<fex>His</fex> later verification of the facts is certainly beyond reproach.
It is extremely difficult to confirm <fex>the absence of something</fex>.
<fex>Chapter four</fex> confirms the reader 's suspicions completely.

passageCandidateSpans.text: the Temple of the True Inner Light

sourceCandidateSpans.text: Schedule I, theregulatory controls and criminal sanctions of Schedule I
